name: mdsQuestionTagGenomics
title: MDS Question Tag Genomics
description: A set of codes use to map MDS Dataset to FHIR Resources.This is intended to be used on Resource.meta.tag.

concept.definition: HCP's function within the genomic test ordering process
HCP's full name.
HCP's job title.
HCP's current specialty.
HCP's phone number.
HCP's email address.
HCP's organisation name.
HCP's organisation address.
HCP's organisation ODS code (ORGANISATION IDENTIFIER (CODE OF ORDERING ENTITY))
HCP's department name.
HCP's professional registration number such as their GMC number.
HCP's professional registration number type such as 'GMC'.
HCP's report preferred delivery method.

concept.display: HCP - Central email for address and reporting (many)
concept.definition: Central email address provided by a HCP.
Patient's title.
Patient's first name.
Patient's last name.
Patient's date of birth.
Patient's home address.
Patient's home postcode.
Patient's home country.

concept.display: Patient - Life status at time of request
concept.definition: Patient's alive or deceased status when ordering the test.
Patient's ethnicity. Includes 'other' / 'not stated'.
Patient's phenotypic sex classification. Physical characteristic. Currently determined by the Dr at birth. Gender for PLCM.

concept.display: Patient - Organisation responsible for GP practice ODS code
concept.definition: ODS code of organisation responsible for the GP Practice where the patient is registered.
Patient's GP practice ODS code. Includes 'N/A' and 'Not Known'.
The fact of the patient's biological parents being descended from the same ancestor.
Patient's GP's full name.
Patient's NHS number.
Patient's identification code other than NHS number. (LOCAL PATIENT IDENTIFIER (EXTENDED))

concept.display: Patient - Reason for unavailable NHS number
concept.definition: Reason for an NHS number not being provided.
This patient's relationship to the primary patient.
Patient's stated gender, determined by the patient.
Patient's date/time of death.
Patient's genomic / karyotypic characteristic. Determined by genomic testing.
Patient's term of active pregnancy at point of test request.
Stage during patient pregnancy at which it terminated.
Patient's estimated delivery date.
Type of conception

concept.display: Patient - IVF age of egg donor
concept.definition: The age of the patient who donated the egg at the time of donation.

concept.display: Patient - Diagnosed with or being treated for cancer
concept.definition: Has the patient been diagnosed with or are they being treated for cancer.
Has the patient ever had a transplant.
What type of transplant the patient had.
When the patient had the transplant.

concept.display: Patient - Had transfusion in the last 6 weeks
concept.definition: Has the patient had a transfusion in the last 6 weeks.
What type of transfusion the patient has had.
When the patient had the transfusion.
Patient's height.
Confirmation why the patient is withholding identity details.
Patient's GP's professional registration number.
Patient's pedigree or family identifying id.
Patient's pregnancy status.
Fetus' identification code other than NHS number.
Fetus' phenotypic sex classification. Estimated physical characteristic. Currently determined by ultrasound. Gender for PLCM.
Fetus' genomic / karyotypic characteristic. Determined by genomic testing.

concept.display: Fetus - Are multiple fetuses being tested
concept.definition: Confirmation that multiple fetuses are being tested.

concept.display: Fetus - Is testing for fetal loss from 24 weeks of gestation
concept.definition: Confirmation that the test is for a loss of pregnancy after 24 weeks gestation.

concept.display: Fetus - Life status at time of request
concept.definition: Fetus' alive or deceased status details at the point of test ordering.
Has RoD been included with request.
Confirmation of who made the RoD decisions.
Name of the clinician who recorded the RoD details.

concept.display: RoD - Record of discussion form - copy attached
concept.definition: Marker to confirm on a test request form that an RoD has been included.
Indication of the patient consenting to the genomic test request.

concept.display: RoD - Has research participation been discussed
concept.definition: Marker to confirm RoD conversation has taken place.
Where consent has been recorded on behalf of the patient via remote confirmation.
If the test is WGS cancer or WGS rare disease.
Why patient has opted out of research.
Name of the clinician who is responsible for the patient's genomic test request.

concept.display: RoD - Patient conversation taken place, ROD form to follow
concept.definition: Marker to confirm RoD conversation has taken place but will be sent separately.
Copy of wet signature or valid e-signature.
A copy of/or link to the previous genomic or non-genomic report.
Unique id to identify this test request.
How the test request is funded

concept.display: Test Request - Date and time request sent
concept.definition: Date and time the test request was sent from the requesting clinician (TEST REQUEST DATE).
The reason for a genomic test.

concept.display: Test Request - High level test identifier
concept.definition: The high level id which identifies the requested test. Options provided by Test Directory.

concept.display: Test Request - High level test identifier description
concept.definition: The high level name of the CI referred to.

concept.display: Test Request - Low level test identifier
concept.definition: The low level CITT code which identifies the requested test. Options provided by Test Directory (TEST IDENTIFIER OR TEST CODE).

concept.display: Test Request - Low level test identifier description
concept.definition: The low level CITT name of the considered test.

concept.display: Test Request - Low level multipurpose test identifier
concept.definition: The low level code which identifies the test to be actioned when the CITT code is multipurpose (CLINICAL INDICATION).

concept.display: Test Request - Low level multipurpose test identifier description
concept.definition: The low level name of the test to be actioned when the CITT code is multipurpose.

concept.display: Test Request - Count of patients to be tested
concept.definition: Count of patients to be tested including the proband/primary patient.
The test request urgency reason.
The reason reanalysis has been requested.

concept.display: Test Request - Detail of reason for reanalysis
concept.definition: Further detail associated to the reason reanalysis has been requested.
The type of reanalysis which has been requested.
If the reason for testing is DNA storage, this captures further detail.
Confirmation if the test request is urgent.

concept.display: Test Request - Date report required by
concept.definition: The date a completed genomic report is required by.
ODS code of the first organisation which receives the genomic test request.

concept.display: Primary Sample - Destination organisation ODS code
concept.definition: Destination for primary sample.
Id of primary sample provided, linked to the stated assigning authority.

concept.display: Primary Sample - Id assigning authority ODS code (many)
concept.definition: Authority who assigned the primary sample id.
Date at which a primary sample was received at a laboratory (SAMPLE RECEIPT DATE).
Where a primary sample is in storage or where it needs to be stored.
Volume of provided primary sample.
The id of the associated genomic test being requested.
Patient NHS number.
Patient identification code other than NHS number.
Date at which a specimen/biopsy was obtained from patient.
Initial sample from patient submitted into a laboratory.
How the primary sample is preserved.
% necrotic cells in primary sample.
Nucleated cell count in the primary sample  (Solid Tumour and Haem-Onc).
Neoplastic cell content in the primary sample(Solid Tumour) - sourced at local lab. (%)
The proportion of the primary sample which is tumour nuclei.
The histology and likely course of development of a tumour.
The tumour sample site. e.g. from colon, stomach etc.
Site where the primary sample was taken from.
If the skin or bone provided is unaffected or affected.
Confirmation if MCC remains in the primary sample.

concept.display: Primary Sample - Option for all products of conception
concept.definition: Future management for products of conception.
Blast count in the primary sample (Haemonc) - sourced at local SIHMDS.

concept.display: Primary Sample - High infection risk reason
concept.definition: The high contamination risk reason for a primary sample.

concept.display: Sample Preparation - Parent primary sample id
concept.definition: Id of primary sample this derived from
Id of sample preparation provided, linked to the stated assigning authority. Occurs multiple times (SAMPLE IDENTIFIER).

concept.display: Sample Preparation - Id assigning authority ODS code (many)
concept.definition: Authority who assigned the sample preparation id(ORGANISATION IDENTIFIER (CODE OF HISTOPATHOLOGY LABORATORY ENTITY))
Where sample preparation is in storage or where it needs to be stored.
Volume of provided sample preparation.
Date at which the sample preparation was completed.
Date at which sample preparation was received at a laboratory (SAMPLE RECEIPT DATE).
Cell separation applied to a primary sample.

concept.display: Final Sample - Parent primary sample id
concept.definition: Id of primary this derived from.

concept.display: Final Sample - Parent sample preparation id
concept.definition: Id of sample preparation this derived from.
Id of final sample provided, linked to the associated assigning authority. Occurs multiple times (SAMPLE IDENTIFIER).

concept.display: Final Sample - Id assigning authority ODS code (many)
concept.definition: Authority who assigned the final sample id ORGANISATION IDENTIFIER (CODE OF HISTOPATHOLOGY LABORATORY ENTITY).
Where a final sample is in storage or where it needs to be stored.
Volume of provided final sample.
Date at which the final sample was extracted.
Date at which a final sample was received at a laboratory (SAMPLE RECEIPT DATE).
Material to be genomically tested.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Report referral summary
concept.definition: Referring clinician's summary of the previous genomic report to support test request.
A copy of/or link to the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Test performed date
concept.definition: The date a previous genomic test was performed.
The identifier for the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's first name
concept.definition: The first name of the patient on the previous genomic report.
The surname of the patient on the previous genomic report.
The address of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's post code
concept.definition: The postcode of the patient on the previous genomic report.
The country of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's date of birth
concept.definition: The date of birth of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's NHS number
concept.definition: The NHS number of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's alternative identifier
concept.definition: The alternative identifier of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's relationship to requesting patient
concept.definition: The relationship of the patient on the previous genomic report to the requesting patient.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's clinical genetic number
concept.definition: The individual clinical genetic number of the patient on the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Patient's pedigree number
concept.definition: The pedigree number of the patient on the previous genomic report which links their family.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Report lab test number
concept.definition: The lab test number from the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Report of genetic analysis
concept.definition: The clinical outcomes from the previous genomic report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Report performer full name
concept.definition: The full name of the individual that authored the previous genomic test report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Report performer organisation ODS code
concept.definition: The organisation ODS code of the individual that authored the previous genomic test report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Original requester full name
concept.definition: The full name of the individual that requested the previous genomic test report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Original requester organisation ODS code
concept.definition: The organisation ODS code of the individual that requested the previous genomic test report.

concept.display: Previous Genomic Report - Original requester reason for request
concept.definition: The reason for requesting the previous genomic test report.
Title of relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Report referral summary
concept.definition: Referring clinician's summary of the previous relevant clinical report to support test request.
A copy of/or link to the relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test performed date
concept.definition: The date a relevant clinical report was performed.
The identifier for the relevant clinical report.
A name that describes the relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result value comparator
concept.definition: A comparator that may be used to indicate whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value. Applies to numeric values only.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result value unit of measure
concept.definition: The name and code of the unit of measure associated with the test result value. Applies to numeric values only.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result reference range low
concept.definition: The reference range low value.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result reference range high
concept.definition: The reference range high value.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result test method
concept.definition: The method of testing/observation that was used.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result reference range text
concept.definition: A human readable text-based description to provide additional information about the reference range. For example, the target population that the reference range applies to and/or differences based on factors such as age or sex.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Test result clinical summary
concept.definition: A human readable text-based clinical interpretation of the test result and any additional notes provided by the performing organisation.
Reference to the result(s)/result groups contained in the relevant clinical report

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Report performer full name
concept.definition: The full name of the individual that authored the relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Report performer organisation ODS code
concept.definition: The identifier of the org which authored the patient's relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Original requester full name
concept.definition: The full name of the individual that requested the relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Original requester organisation ODS code
concept.definition: The organisation ODS code of the individual that requested the relevant clinical report.

concept.display: Relevant Clinical Report - Original requester reason for request
concept.definition: The reason for requesting the relevant clinical report.
Patient's ethnicity where 'Patient - Ethnicity field' doesn't provide an adequate description. E.g Ashkenazi Jewish
If the patient is affected, unaffected, or it is unknown.
The patient's date of diagnosis.
The age when a change in patients' health was first noted in line with suspected diagnosis.
Disease a patient is believed, known to have, or be at risk of developing.
The HPO (or alternative ontology as appropriate) term names for the observable disease traits.
The patient's symptoms at onset.
Confirms if all individuals with a disease show clinical symptoms or if there are carriers who do not.
Does the patient have multiple tumours.
How many tumours the patient has.
Location of the tumours on the body.
The patient's solid tumour type.
The patient's liquid tumour type.
Image attachment of body with tumour sites highlighted.
The patient's pedigree/family history details (inc family history of cancer).
Image attachment of pedigree details
Laterality of the hearing loss i.e. bilateral or unilateral.
Maternal screening genotype for haemoglobinopathy testing.
If the patient is on tyrosine kinase inhibitor therapy.

concept.display: Is patient in treatment free remission
concept.definition: If the patient is in treatment free remission.
Legal considerations for a given request.
Paternal screening genotype for haemoglobinopathy testing.
Requesting clinician's organisation name.
Requesting clinician's organisation address.

concept.display: Expected Maternity Unit - Organisation ODS code
concept.definition: Requesting clinician's organisation ODS code.
Requesting clinician's department name.
Summary passage of text to highlight patient centile history e.g. head circumference, weight, etc.
Free text regarding hearing loss
Free text regarding retinal degeneration
Toxic medication - Prematurity (risk factor for hearing loss) e.g. Baby early birth - Ototoxic medication.
Suspected inborn error type(s)
Abnormal infection history site organism
Abnormal infection history site organism
If the patient is on immunoglobin replacement treatment.
Supporting information which has not been captured elsewhere.
